result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sha Metrice K Blackmore

records.addlTxt:
Court is down and unable to hear this case.  Parties emailed new court date.  Defendant appeared by zoom and was given new court date.  Case adjourned, Br 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sha Metrice K Blackmore appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Sha Metrice K Blackmore.  Attorney Katherine Seelow in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing date by zoom.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Sha Metrice K Blackmore in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sha Metrice K Blackmore in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 35.  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sha Metrice K Blackmore in court.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for preliminary hearing. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Contact with children listed in the criminal complaint permitted provided it comports with any orders from Children's Court or DMCPS, if said orders exist.

Defendant Sha Metrice K Blackmore in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 1.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/26/2022 @01:00pm
